alert.note: Alert for Southern Twin Falls County (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:43PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Twin Falls and southeastern Jerome Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 542 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rock Creek, or 9 miles southeast of Twin Falls, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hansen and Kimberly around 600 PM MDT. Eden, Hazelton and Murtaugh around 610 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
